Chapter on Contemplating the Heavens, Part 35, Twenty-First on the Heaven of YÄma
Furthermore, the bhiká¹£us know the fruits of karma and contemplate the abodes of the YÄma Heaven.
With their wisdom from hearing [the Dharma] or with the divine eye, they see:
In the YÄma Heaven there is another place called Constant Joy.
What karma do sentient beings have that causes them to be born in that place?
They see:

If a person does not kill, does not steal, as explained above, always avoids sexual misconduct, and even when seeing a painted woman does not think of lustful thoughts, and does not give rise to the superior appearance of that painted woman.
When seeing a painted woman, do not give rise to thoughts:
'She resembles such-and-such a woman.'

The mind also does not give rise to thoughts of endearment, does not contemplate in this way, and does not contemplate the painted woman with a lustful mind. The mind is not deluded, and the mind relies on the true Dharma.
Due to right mindfulness, they abandon lustful thoughts, avoid women, and destroy their own bodies.
Having contemplated thus, they do not engage in sexual misconduct themselves. Joy arises in their minds, and they prevent unarisen lustful thoughts from arising.
They encourage those who engage in sexual misconduct to abide in the right path, and explain to them the faults of desire that are not to be enjoyed.

If one can thus abandon sexual misconduct, it is the foremost pure bodily action. With right view and non-greed, at the end of life, one is reborn in the celestial realms of good destination, in the Heaven of YÄma, in the place of constant joy.

In the intermediate state up to the heavenly realm, all is due to good karma. The five faculties experience pleasure, with form, sound, smell, taste, and touch all complete, and one is gradually reborn in the heavens.
In those heavens, one is born in three places through transformation:
First, born in the center of a lotus flower;
Second, born in the beard of a kupaoluo flower;
Third, born in a mandÄra flower.

If born in the stamens of the kovidÄra flower, the light and color are also like the flower, either red, blue, or various colors, and adorned with the seven treasures, also like the stamens of the kovidÄra.
How are they adorned with the various colors of the seven treasures?

The hair is made of blue vaiá¸Å«rya, the eyelashes and eyelids are also like this, the fingernails are silver-colored, the teeth are red and white like pearls, the body is like JambÅ«nada gold, the hair below the navel is the color of indranÄ«la, and the other parts of the body are various colors.
The painter of the mind creates like a painting.

If born in the pericarp of the lotus flower, the color is also like this, like the color of genuine JambÅ«nada gold, the hair is the color of blue jewels, the lips are the color of red lotus flowers or cat's eye gems, the nails are the color of lotus flowers, and the hair below the navel is the color of dark blue cat's eye gems.
Only a small part is mentioned.
If born from a mandÄra flower, their bodies and garments have various colors, because they are born in the middle of the flower, they resemble its colors.

This means that they are similar. It is like the present-seen dharma. Whatever colored fruit there is, the creatures born in it are born with the same color, because they are born in the middle of it.
The same is true for similar types. According to the place where they are born, they have the same color. It is also like this.
Because they are in the flower, everything is similar.
After the celestial beings are born, they always possess various pleasures, uninterrupted and unceasing, constantly experiencing heavenly bliss, which cannot be compared.
Among those pleasures, only a small part is described, like a single drop of water in the ocean. The pleasures described are also like this.
If in the human realm one performs good deeds, hearing this heavenly bliss, the mind becomes diligent.
Why is this?
Because one knows the fruits of karma, one aspires to this blissful retribution and diligently cultivates good deeds.
Just as one who strives diligently for liberation, in order to destroy the immeasurable suffering within existence, destroys the poison of craving, and sees that there is no joy within existence.
For this reason, it is said that the fruits of wholesome actions are the pleasures of the heavens, not the fruits of existence.

At that time, the newly born celestial being, in the place of constant bliss in this heaven, always enjoys the pleasures of the five desires and amusements there, and is praised and worshipped by hundreds of thousands of celestial maidens singing and chanting.

In the gardens and forests, lotus ponds and rivers, in such places, with various songs and dances, they enjoy themselves together, without obstructing each other. Experiencing pleasures according to their own actions, in the gardens and forests, on level ground, mountain peaks, and lotus groves, they always enjoy heavenly pleasures.

At that time, the celestial beings, surrounded by the celestial maidens, in each and every place, each and every garden and forest, each and every delightful place of amusement, each and every peak of the seven-jeweled mountains, experience heavenly desires and love, yet are never satisfied.

They see all the lovely and wonderful lotus ponds, hear wonderful sounds, eat heavenly flavors, wear the finest and softest heavenly garments, and enjoy the fragrances they love, experiencing the five desires for a long time, enjoying each other's company.
At that time, there was a bird named 'Time of Awakening.' For the sake of the careless heavenly multitudes, it spoke in verse, saying:
In the three realms of existence, all will die.
The foolish are unable to give rise to disgust and detachment in birth and death.
All will certainly die, so all should diligently make effort.
When the enemy of death arrives, there is no one who can save them.
It can sever all happiness and add to various sufferings and afflictions.
It separates from all that is loved, and therefore it is called death.
It can give rise to fear in sentient beings and can bring great suffering and distress.
It can cause the mind to be confused and deluded, and therefore it is called death.ğŸ”½Here is the corrected and aligned text:
Able to sever the mind that cherishes life, able to destroy the faculties,
Beings are unable to destroy it, therefore it is called death.
Beings are unable to destroy it, karma is unable to surpass it,
Causing beings to lose and be destroyed, therefore it is called death.
All beings have it, it is able to kill decisively,
Causing separation from what is loved, therefore it is called death.
Celestial beings, yakshas, gandharvas, ghosts, dragons, rakshasas, and so forth,
The wheel of time is able to kill all, therefore it is called death.
Disturbing and difficult to subdue, to all it is like fire,
Firm and unyielding, unable to avoid it, therefore it is called death.
Able to destroy the aggregates and sense bases, life-force, and mind,
The power of the Dharma of time is great, therefore it is called death.
Its progress is extremely swift, destroying all beings,
You should diligently cultivate meritorious deeds and not be negligent.
The birds that speak of the truth tell the careless gods about the law of death, which is certain and without doubt.
However, because of their carelessness, the assembly of gods, although hearing this teaching, do not give rise to disgust, because the nature of their faculties is naturally restless.
Those who experience much pleasure have restless faculties and are also difficult to subdue;
because pleasure is superior, their faculties are restless and cannot be subdued.
For this reason, although this assembly of gods hears the true, solid, and beneficial teachings, they are unaware and do not understand their meaning.
Even if they are aware, they are harmed by the poison of craving and do not accept it even when they are aware.
For this reason, although they hear true words and beneficial truths, they do not accept them.

Because they do not accept the Dharma, they first become attached to beautiful objects and experience the pleasures of the five senses, with the sounds of the five musical instruments, laughter, singing and dancing, and various games.

In the gardens, forests, and lotus ponds, together with the celestial maidens, due to their good karma, they constantly experience pleasures on the lovely mountain peaks adorned with the seven treasures, without interruption.
Endowed with all the merits of celestial desires, they enjoy themselves together. Adorned with various precious treasures, they constantly experience pleasures on the ground.
Thus, they play and experience various pleasures, and continue to wander. They arrive at a vast pond.

The pond is one hundred yojanas long and wide. There is a lotus flower, soft to the touch, inlaid with the seven treasures. Its stem is made of lapis lazuli, and its pistils are made of vajra. The flower is in full bloom, covering the entire large pond.
This group of celestials has never seen such a thing before. Having seen this flower, they give rise to a rare thought:
This celestial realm is extremely delightful. Everywhere one looks, it is delightful.

The gods, seeing this, are a hundred times more joyful. They point to each other, all looking up, surrounding it on one side, playing together, their minds filled with joy, observing this lotus flower, all giving rise to a rare mind, and say to each other:
'Look, look!
This lovely lotus flower has never been seen before. It has great light and is adorned with countless seven-jeweled bees, adorning this great jeweled lotus.'
This great lotus flower completely covers the great pond, surrounding the flower, with a small part of the water visible.
On the banks of the vast pond, interspersed with pearls, sapphires, red lotus flowers, and silver-colored jewels, it is adorned with various decorations.
The great lotus flower platform is five yojanas high and ten yojanas wide.

In accordance with the thoughts of the gods, by the power of their good karma, when they are enjoying themselves and seeking pleasure, it is either large or small according to the thoughts in the gods' minds.

Just as the mind of the gods thinks, the lotus flowers in the great pond are all complete, therefore this pond is called the pond of following thoughts, and the flowers are called the lotuses of following thoughts.
Thus, these two things are called following thoughts.

At that time, when the heavenly multitudes first see it, their minds give rise to a hundred times more joy. Due to good karma, they sing, dance, play, laugh, and make music on the banks of that pond, all together experiencing such heavenly pleasures.
At that time, the heavenly multitudes, having played, again drink the heavenly drinks of the highest flavor, free from the fault of intoxication.
Having drunk the highest flavor, the merits of experiencing bliss are obtained just as one thinks. Just as one thinks of fragrance, just as one thinks of color, just as one thinks of flavor.
Just as one recollects various jeweled vessels, in that pond there are immediately jeweled vessels filled with the highest flavor, flowing out from the pond.
Heavenly wine of the most delicious flavor flows out from the pond, and these heavenly multitudes drink this highest flavor.

Having drunk the finest flavors, they again go to other places to play and enjoy themselves. They see the Suta gathering, with color, aroma, taste, and touch all complete. Desiring to eat it, they joyfully approach.
Having arrived at the place of food, they all eat it together, either eating with their hands or using jeweled utensils, according to their karma.
Having eaten the Suta, they return to the vast pond from where they came.
They mutually give rise to joyful minds, surrounded by heavenly multitudes, with the sounds of the five types of music, singing, laughing, and playing, they go to the vast pond.

They see a great lotus flower with surpassing radiance surpassing that of a hundred thousand suns. The wondrous jeweled radiance of all those heavens is not even one-sixteenth of the radiance of the flower.

At that time, the heavenly multitudes see the great lotus flower and are extremely joyful. The heavenly multitudes surround it, with the sounds of the five types of music, singing, playing, and surrounding the great pond, all going along with it.
In this way, following the path around the pond, they see even more rare and wonderful things in the pond.
Above the flower pond, there are many kinds of beautiful seven-jeweled bees, male and female, enjoying themselves and experiencing pleasure, drinking the nectar of the flowers together.
The delicious flavor of the flower nectar is indescribable. Having drunk the nectar, they speak in verse, saying:
If one creates various karmic actions, one will experience various fruits.
Those who are born in various ways are so because of various karmic actions.
Because the mind is mixed, there are various kinds. One creates various bases.
Because various karmic actions are exhausted, one will soon be destroyed.
The heavenly pleasures one experiences here cannot be fully described.
The power of impermanence is sovereign. It will soon arrive in an instant.
Pleasure is like water bubbles, like a mirage that is not water.
All pleasures are like this. They will all be destroyed.
The most evil cannot be stopped, all beings are terrified,
The king of death is about to arrive, his power is indestructible.
Destroying all happiness, and cutting off the life force,
Bound by the chains of karma, he will lead us to another world.
If past happiness is gone, that happiness cannot be remembered;
If happiness is in the future, it is also not called happiness;
If happiness dwells in the present, it is mixed with desirable objects;
Impermanence moves and changes, all is destroyed.
If happiness belongs to the three realms, it is not praised by the wise,
How can the heavenly multitudes love and enjoy such happiness?
This body does not remain for long, the fire of death will definitely come,
Able to burn and destroy everything, like fire consuming dry firewood.
All happiness quickly passes away, do not be negligent,
Do not give rise to regret at the time of death.
In countless hundreds of thousands of lives, all karmic pleasures have already passed,
Like a dream reaching somewhere, like the wind, thoughts do not abide.
The foolish delight without satiation, like fire obtaining dry firewood,
Therefore, the pleasures one is attached to are not true and lasting pleasures.
Those who are liberated from thirst and craving are able to leave behind the faults of desire,
Cultivating meditation and being heedful, they attain the pure bliss free from defilements.
Those who attain such bliss can be said to have true bliss,
All existences, though called bliss, are like mixed poison and honey.
Those who are attached to such bliss always seek sensual pleasures,
Sensual pleasures are not true and lasting bliss, therefore they are not tranquil.
' In this way, the bees, due to their good karma, spoke these verses for the sake of the heavenly multitudes.

Although the heavenly beings heard this teaching, they did not accept it. They continued to observe the pond, giving rise to a sense of delight. Together with the heavenly maidens, they frolicked, sang and danced, and observed everywhere.

For a long time, they enjoyed themselves in this place. They then wished to observe the lotus flowers in the pond. Due to the power of the four elements of lightness and freedom, and the power of karma, they freely roamed within the lotus pond.
Some heavenly beings entered the lotus petals to frolic and enjoy themselves, while others entered the various wondrous jeweled lotus pedestals to enjoy pleasures together with the heavenly maidens.
Within the lotus pedestals, according to their thoughts, they ascended to the lotus petals.
At that time, the lotus petals gradually grew larger and larger. Due to good karma, the lotus flowers grew to two hundred yojanas, three hundred yojanas, and even one thousand yojanas.
Due to the power of the heavenly beings' good karma and thoughts, the pedestals also gradually grew larger to two hundred yojanas;
The light of the great lotus flower is also like this, gradually growing larger.
At that time, the heavenly multitudes each dwell in the other flower petals, playing and enjoying pleasures together with the heavenly maidens.
When these heavenly multitudes ascend to the flower petals, the petals immediately grow larger.
At that time, the heavenly multitudes playing and enjoying pleasures have this thought:
'We should now give rise to a river of wine and food in this place where we play and stay.'
Immediately upon this thought, in the lotus petals a river of wine and food are born, all complete.
They further think like this:
'We should now drink wine and eat the flavor of food.'
Then, together with the heavenly maidens, they drink heavenly wine and eat the flavor of food.
At that time, the heavenly multitudes, having long enjoyed pleasures, further have this thought:
'We should now give rise to a garden grove in this place where we stay and play.'
Due to good karma, whatever they think of, such as gardens and forests, will appear.
There are trees of the seven treasures with various birds singing in various ways. The trees' shade covers like palaces, with flowers and fruits in abundance.
Whatever flowers and fruits they think of, they can obtain them at any time.

There are various rivers, springs, ponds, and streams that are excellent and delightful, with various wonderful sounds. The jeweled ground is adorned with various wonderful flowers with beautiful colors, fragrances, and appearances.

There are three kinds of flowers: blue utpala flowers, jasmine flowers, amaranth flowers, suchi flowers, fragrant leaf flowers, lin flowers, fully desirous flowers, rava flowers, and kunjara flowers. There are such water-born flowers.
In the light of the flowers, there are many bees. Such flowers have various colors as one wishes. There are the colors of blue jewels, which grow everywhere.
Such heavenly flowers adorn the forest.
Moreover, various flowers grow on land, with various colors and shapes, extremely delightful, growing in this forest.
Those heavenly beings dwell in such lotus leaves, namely the flower of joyful light, which the sons and daughters of heaven call and it comes.

There is another flower called seeing joy, another flower called various colors, the flower of joyful unfolding soft leaves, the flower of all light and excellent adornment, the flower of jÅ«tan, the flower of insatiable, the flower of remembering joy, there are such land-born flowers.
When the heavens think of them, they all appear.

In the groves there are also various flowers, namely, mandara flowers, joyful flowers, fragrant and delightful flowers, fragrant and delicious flowers, chitara flowers, five-petaled flowers, dragon-grove tongue flowers, chamara flowers, grove garland flowers, sumana flowers, luminous flowers, satiating flowers with fragrant scent, all delightful flowers, mountain garland flowers, and mountain peak garland flowers.
Such flowers grow under trees and in thickets.
When the gods reside in the lotus flowers and play, by the power of good karma, these flowers are born.
At that time, the heavenly multitudes together with the celestial maidens reside in the lotus groves, playing among the flower petals and experiencing various pleasures.
That great lotus flower, according to one's thoughts, expands the pond. Its power is like this.
At that time, the heavenly multitudes in the lotus petals have this thought:
'In this place, there should be many mountains.'
Various jeweled peaks emerge from this, replete with light, various birds and various wonderful sounds in the mountain peaks.
Caves, rivers, ponds, flat areas, steep cliffs, and jeweled lands - in such places, I should play.
He further thought like this:
'I now dwell on this great lotus leaf. If there are caves, rivers, ponds, flat lands, and flowing springs here, I will play and enjoy myself in them.'

By the power of good karma, at the moment of thought, there were many gardens, forests, flower ponds, mountain peaks, caves, and flat tops, all delightful, adorned with the light of the seven treasures, and the branches of various trees were very delightful, bringing joy to the heart upon seeing them.

Beyond a hundred mountains, heavenly flower and fruit trees, with branches and foliage covering like palaces, were very delightful, and a hundred thousand jeweled caves grew in the mountains as adornments.

At that time, the celestial beings, leaving the lotus leaves, surrounded by a thousand celestial maidens, with the most exquisite celestial flowers, complete with color, fragrance, and touch, without any wilting or change,
adorned with celestial maidens, singing beautiful songs in perfect harmony, pleasing to the hearer's mind.
In accordance with the heavens, endowed with the five desires, slowly ascending the great mountain, casting their eyes to observe all around.
At that time, the celestial beings, playing and enjoying themselves, eating from the food river, drinking the flowing flavors,

having eaten innumerable foods and drinks, then by the river's side, taking mandara flowers and kusha flowers, adorning their bodies, further adorning the celestial maidens, singing and dancing in amusement.

Having long enjoyed the pleasures of the five desires, experiencing the pleasures of the beloved objects, not knowing contentment, being carried away by the river of desire, they again head towards the great lotus flower in the vast pond.

These heavenly beings, either a hundred or a thousand, surrounded by heavenly maidens adorned in various ways, arrive at the great pond, each going to their own dwelling in the petals of the lotus flowers, each playing and enjoying the most delightful and wonderful pleasures.
Like a seal stamping, each experiences pleasures similar to their own karma.
At that time, the heavenly beings had another thought:
'In this place, there should be various mountains and valleys, various kinds of birds with various appearances, eating together in groups, seeing which brings joy to the mind.
With bodies of the seven treasures, emitting wonderful sounds, able to go everywhere without obstruction, either in the water, on land, or flying in the sky without fatigue.

If there are such birds that come to this place, we will ride them and travel through the sky, playing with the heavenly maidens in the sky, looking down at the heavenly beings of the realm of constant bliss who are enjoying pleasures.
Having observed everywhere, they will again enjoy supreme pleasures with the celestial maidens.

When the celestial assembly has this thought, various mountains, mountain peaks, mountain valleys, mountain caves, various forests, and various flocks of birds will come as they wish due to the power of good karma.

With various appearances, various adornments, various excellent and wonderful sounds of the kalaviá¹…ka bird, and various birds of the seven treasures and mixed colors, when the celestial maidens see them, they all give rise to a sense of wonder.
Their beautiful sounds fill the sky and all come to this place of celestial play within the petals of the lotus flowers, covering the sky everywhere.
At that time, when the celestial assembly and celestial maidens see those birds, their joy increases.
Because of their joy, they wish to ascend into the sky together with the celestial maidens.

At that time, the birds know the thoughts of the gods and come close to the assembly of gods. The sons of the gods and the celestial maidens ascend the birds, and the birds then fly through the sky. Holding a pipa, they sing various wonderful sounds, with flutes, reed pipes, and drums, which are very delightful, and the mind is delighted upon hearing them.

Furthermore, they observe the assembly of gods in their own realm enjoying celestial pleasures, with minds attached to joy and love, not thinking of falling, because of their wholesome karma, they only experience celestial bliss.
At that time, there was a bird named Truth-Speaker. In order to discipline the assembly of gods who are indulging in pleasures, it spoke in verse, saying:
The birds gather and fly with violent winds, their movements are extremely swift,
The life of all beings passes even faster than this.
The wind may move or return, the birds may go but sometimes return,
But once the life force is destroyed, there is no chance of coming back.
Because karma is quickly exhausted, one quickly arrives at the time of death,
Will definitely leave the heavens, but fools do not realize this.
Powerful and unstoppable, extremely evil and hateful towards beings,
The king of death is extremely brave and strong, and will definitely arrive in an instant.
The heavens are often negligent, deceived by pleasures,
Not realizing that they will definitely attain immeasurable great suffering.
All phenomena are impermanent, and will definitely be destroyed,
All existing phenomena are like this, and this is the most frightening.
Old age can destroy youthful appearance, and death can destroy life,
Ruin and destruction of resources, the corresponding phenomena are like this.
In such great evil, decline, and great fear,
If one still acts negligently, this is called a mindless person.
If one fears the future, then this is called having the eye of wisdom,
If one goes against this, then this is great ignorance.
All mental activities deceive, causing the mind to be confused and disordered,
When karma is exhausted, it is destroyed, like a lamp going out when the oil is used up.
Immeasurable sense objects and pleasures, these pleasures are all impermanent,
Because the original karma is exhausted, they will surely return to destruction.'
The truthful birds, by the power of good karma, in order to subdue the minds of the devas, spoke these verses.
At that time, the assembly of devas, due to their indulgence, foolishly did not realize, and their minds did not believe or accept.
Again, they observed such a place of constant pleasure, lovely mountains and valleys, rivers, springs, flowing water, flower ponds, and gardens.
In each flower grove, mountain peak, and ravine, the assembly of devas filled it, playing in the sky, hearing the various songs, filling the sky.

At that time, the heavenly multitudes again saw in other places many celestial sons and celestial maidens drinking heavenly flavors on the banks of flower ponds, enjoying pleasures with the sounds of the five kinds of music from wish-fulfilling trees.

They further went to other places and saw palaces in the sky, with celestial sons, celestial maidens, and celestial garlands adorning them, and the five desires of the heavens all complete, playing and enjoying pleasures.
They saw the two heavenly multitudes combined into one assembly, playing and enjoying pleasures in the sky.
Riding on birds adorned with the seven treasures, the celestial beings of NÄrÄyaá¹‡a Forest dwelling in palaces, these two heavenly multitudes all united, enjoying each other in the sky.
After playing for a long time in the sky, they again ascended mountain peaks, and after enjoying pleasures on the mountain peaks for a long time, they went to the vast pond, thinking of flowers.
Some rode on birds, filling the sky, soaring and flying, singing heavenly melodies. These heavenly beings, thinking of supreme bliss, again headed for the Vast Pond.
Having arrived at the pond, they descended from the birds and entered the lotus leaves of the Vast Pond, as previously described, enjoying various pleasures and happiness.
At that time, the heavenly beings, having long enjoyed pleasures in the great lotus flowers of the Vast Pond, again thought like this:
'Now we should give rise to branches and leaves that shade the palaces, with the sounds of cuckoos and various wonderful treasures and flower groves adorning this place.
Branches and leaves of various precious colors shade and form palaces. We should play and enjoy ourselves there.'
Due to their good karma, as soon as they had this thought, various wonderful treasures with radiant adornments, with the first wonderful flower colors and fragrances, covered above them.
Namely, white silver, vaiá¸Å«rya jewels, great blue sapphire kings, red lotus jewels, crystal-colored jewels, and even gold-colored jewels, all of the finest quality, delightful to behold.
Such various jeweled branches and leaves shade the palace, born in accordance with thoughts due to the power of good karma.
At that time, when the heavenly multitudes see these branches and leaves shading the palace, their hearts are filled with joy. They enter this palace and enjoy pleasures.

Surrounded by heavenly maidens, their bodies adorned with heavenly garments and garlands, all heavenly desires are fully present. Their minds are harmonious and unobstructed, free from jealousy, quarrels, anger, and resentment as they experience pleasurable activities.
Due to good karma, they experience these heavenly pleasures.

The sounds of the five types of music are all equal. Within the palace covered by the shade of branches and leaves, they enjoy sensual pleasures with the celestial maidens, their minds insatiable. Burned by the poison of desire, they experience the pleasures of the five senses without knowing satiation, which is beyond analogy.
Within the palace covered by the shade of branches and leaves, they experience the supreme bliss of the heavens, deeply enjoying their accomplishments.
Thus, the palace covered by the shade of branches and leaves is made of various jewels. The trees are of lapis lazuli, with true gold leaves and red lotus flowers as fruits.
The branches are made of blue indra jewels.ğŸ”½Some have leaves of white silver and fruits of crystal;
some have leaves of blue jewels and fruits of red lotus flowers;
some have leaves of various jewels and fruits of various jewels;
some have leaves of true gold and fruits of white silver;
the same is true for golden leaves and golden fruits.
The palace covered by various branches and leaves is complete in all respects, in accordance with the thoughts of the heavens, due to their good karma.
At that time, the celestial sons, together with the celestial maidens, joyfully entered the palace chambers covered by branches and leaves, and remained in silence.
Together with the celestial maidens, they played and experienced various pleasures, like fish in water, never knowing enough.
In this palace chamber covered by branches and leaves, they gave rise to a rare state of mind. Within the palace chamber, they frolicked, sang, and enjoyed themselves, experiencing pleasure.
After experiencing pleasure, they further thought like this:
'In this place, within the palace chamber covered by branches and leaves, the first colors, smells, tastes, and textures should arise.
The celestial supreme flavors flow out from the leaves, and together with the celestial maidens, they drink and experience bliss.'

Due to their good karma, at the very moment of thought, celestial supreme drinks, with the first colors, smells, tastes, and textures, flowed out from the leaves, and together with the celestial maidens, they drank and experienced bliss.
Their minds were insatiable, and with desirous minds, they sang, danced, and played for a long time, experiencing pleasure.
Due to carelessness, they do not know contentment - the karma they created in the past is about to expire - they play and enjoy themselves, thirsting for sense objects, not knowing contentment.
They further think:
'Now, in this flower and leaf, the first taste of sudhÄ should be born, endowed with smell, taste, and touch.'
Due to good karma, as soon as they think of it, the first sudhÄ endowed with smell, taste, and touch emerges from the leaf, and they eat it.
When the heavenly multitudes have long enjoyed themselves, they further think:

'Now, in this branch of the jeweled tree, jeweled beads, necklaces, ornaments, the most wonderful heavenly crowns, complete with radiance, arm ornaments, and so forth - all kinds of heavenly adornments and bright decorations should emerge from the branches.'
As soon as they think this, due to the power of good karma, various heavenly adornments and bright decorations emerge.

At that time, the heavenly beings, adorned with ornaments, having long enjoyed heavenly pleasures, not knowing to be content, together with the heavenly maidens, experience the pleasures of the five desires, not knowing to be content.
Although they have long enjoyed pleasures, in the midst of objects, their thirst and craving increase. With an unsettled mind, they give rise to different thoughts:
'Now, in this place, there should be a fragrant breeze coming, blowing on the tree leaves, rubbing against each other and producing wonderful sounds, surpassing the sounds of singing.'

When they give rise to this thought, due to their good karma, various fragrant breezes blow, moving the tree leaves, rubbing against each other and producing wonderful sounds, of which the singing voices of the heavenly maidens are not even a sixteenth part.
At that time, the heavenly beings, together with the heavenly maidens, sing and dance, playing and enjoying themselves for a long time, still not knowing to be content.
At that time, the heavenly beings give rise to this thought:
'I should now give rise to various seven-jeweled, multi-colored, adorned palaces at the place where I dwell, with all heavenly desires fully endowed, arising in accordance with thought.
Having arisen like this, they will be all-pervasively present around this vast pond.
In the sky, together with the heavenly maidens, singing, dancing, playing, laughing, and enjoying pleasures.'
When this thought arises, there will immediately be various seven-jeweled palaces with multi-colored adornments, adorned with pearl necklaces.
On the four sides of the palace, there are various wonderful railings made of many treasures, which are delightful to behold.
On the railings, there are either geese, peacocks, or myna birds, and various other birds residing on them.
Everywhere there are birds resting, and various birds appear before them as they wish.
When the heavenly beings see this, they ascend these palaces together with the heavenly maidens to play, sing, and dance, all going towards the vast pond.
